noun.description: (in some US states) a meeting at which local members of a political party register their preference among candidates running for office or select delegates to attend a convention.
examples: Hawaii holds its nominating caucuses next Tuesday
he stumbled through the Iowa caucuses and the New Hampshire primary

noun.description: A conference of members of a legislative body who belong to a particular party or faction.
examples: Mr. Kerry attended the morning caucus in the Old Senate Chamber where his fellow Democrats selected the new minority leadership

noun.description: A group within an organization or political party which meets independently to discuss strategy or tactics.
examples: up to fifty caucuses met daily on conference grounds to discuss lobbying strategies
he was forced out by a hard-left caucus which had taken over his constituency party

verb.description: Hold or form a legislative caucus.
examples: there is one Independent who caucuses with the Democrats

origin: Mid 18th century: perhaps from Algonquian cau'-cau'-as'u adviser.
